content.question:
City health officials will conduct a two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in means to investigate whether stray dogs in the city have more fleas, on average, than do stray cats. A random sample of 22 stray dogs had a mean of 120 fleas and a standard deviation of 20 fleas. A random sample of 15 stray cats had a mean of 100 fleas and a standard deviation of 30 fleas.
Assuming a null hypothesis of no difference, which of the following is a correct test statistic for the test?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 120 minus 100, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 20 plus 30, and denominator 22 plus 15, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>22</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 120 minus 100, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 20 squared plus 30 squared, and denominator 22 plus 15, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>22</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 120 minus 100, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 20 squared, and denominator 22, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 30 squared, and denominator 15, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>22</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 120 minus 100, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 20, and denominator 22, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 30, and denominator 15, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>22</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the square root of the complex fraction with numerator 120 minus 100, and denominator the fraction with numerator 30 squared, and denominator 22, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 20 squared, and denominator 15, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>22</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 120 minus 100, and denominator the square root of the fraction with numerator 20 squared, and denominator 22, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 30 squared, and denominator 15, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>22</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
